This appears to be caused by two build error for the .WtpEjbEmmitter project of
the form:

Severity	Description	Resource	In Folder	Location	Creation Time
2	Project .WtpEjbEmitter is missing required library:
'c:/apps/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ejb.annotation.model_0.7.0.jar!/ejbAnnotationModel.jar'
.WtpEjbEmitter			June 16, 2005 11:05:33 AM


Note: the referenced jar is there and that plugin is visible in the eclipse
runtime; don't know if something else in my config could be causing the problem
or if something in the latest builds are having trouble interpreting classpath
entries of the form: <classpathentry kind="lib"
path="file:c:/apps/eclipse/plugins/org.eclipse.jst.j2ee.ejb.annotation.model_0.7.0.jar!/ejbAnnotationModel.jar"/>

The bug is related to jarred plugins, jet emitter cannot get the plugin jar from
inside the jar to add to its classpath.

Trying to pack classes to the root of the plugin, if it fails I will unpack the
ejb plugins.

I have tracked the bug to deprecate code in WtpJetEmitter, and opened an other
bug, please see: https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=100510

I'm no longer seeing the original exception, however, creation of an EJB within
a J2EE EJB Project (not a flexible project) is still blocked; here's the current
exception (note: the TestBean.java class is generated):
